message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.DB

This paper deals with improving the efficiency of algorithms for probabilistic inference in Bayesian networks, which is a common problem in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The algorithm presented in the paper involves determining which potentials to multiply on-line, which suggests a focus on data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of large real-world Bayesian networks also suggests a focus on databases (cs.DB). Finally, the exploitation of independence relations induced by evidence and the direction of links in the original network suggests a focus on statistical inference (cs.SI).
